rawtext:
This free program of short courses is designed to help you understand the basics of teaching with Moodle.

Once you complete all the courses you will receive a badge for completing the program. You can also choose to purchase a certificate of completion.

This program relates to the following competences: 3.1 Teaching; 5.1 Accessibility and inclusion.
Moodle Teaching Basics

This free program of short beginner level courses is designed to help you understand the basics of teaching with Moodle.

Once you complete all the courses you will receive a badge for completing the program.

You can also choose to purchase a certificate of completion.

If you already understand the basics of teaching with Moodle, why not try our Intermediate level program Moodle Teaching Skills?
Before you begin, review the Program overview, Learning outcomes, Program structure and Completion and assessment information.
Digital competences

"Being digitally competent means using digital technologies in a confident and safe way" (DigComp 2.0).

Moodle Academy courses and programs in the Educator learning pathway use a Moodle specific version of the Digital Competence Framework for Educators (DigCompEdu). This is the same framework used by the advanced Moodle Educator Certification (MEC).

This program relates to the following competences:

  • 3.1 Teaching;
  • 5.1 Accessibility and inclusion.

To complete the program you need to complete the following activities:

  • View the 'About this program' book.
  • Complete all the courses in the program.

Completing the courses in this program

  • The courses in this program will be automatically marked as completed, once you meet all the criteria to pass each course.  These activities have a checkbox with a dashed line border.

Program badge

  • Upon successful completion of this program of courses you will be automatically awarded a program badge to showcase the skills and knowledge you have obtained.

All notable changes to this course will be documented in this page.

Date: DD Month YYYY
Changed by: 
Changes:

  • ...
  • ...
  • ...

By the end of this program, participants will be able to:

  • Define the layout of your own Moodle course as a teacher;
  • Display information in your course in an accessible and inclusive way;
  • Add a variety of Moodle activities to your course;
  • Set up activities with automatic or manual grading;
  • Confidently create a mobile-friendly Moodle course;
  • Identify common accessibility issues within a Moodle course and remedy them.
Program overview

Aim

In this program you will learn how to:

  • Start teaching with Moodle;
  • Create course content;
  • Develop Moodle Activities;
  • Manage your course;
  • Create an accessible course that does not disadvantage particular students.

Format

This is a self-paced program of short courses without active moderation. You are encouraged to discuss ideas in the discussion forums and respond to other learners' queries.

Learning time

The estimated learning time to complete this program is 15 hours.
Program structure

Welcome

Find out how the program works and post a welcome message to the other participants completing the program at the same time.

Courses

Complete all the courses in this program to receive your program badge.

You will automatically receive a badge once you have completed all the courses in this program.

Certificate of completion

Upon completion you can choose to purchase a certificate for a small fee.

Feedback

We'd love to hear what you thought of the program and if you have any suggestions for improvements. You can also give feedback within each course.

Once you complete this program you will be able to purchase a certificate of completion for a small fee.

If you complete this program successfully, why not take another course, or complete a further program? 

We offer a range of free courses and programs in three learning pathways, as well as general courses for everyone:

  • Educator learning pathway.
  • Administrator learning pathway.
  • Developer learning pathway.
  • General courses.

This program is formed of courses licensed under Creative Commons (CC) licences. You should attribute the authors of each course and the specific CC licence individually. Original resources available at https://moodle.academy.
